com.nttdocomo.ui
Class TextBox

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.nttdocomo.ui.Component
        |
        +--com.nttdocomo.ui.TextBox
All Implemented Interfaces:
Interactable
public final class TextBox
extends Component
implements Interactable

This defines the component for text input. The text box class is one UI component that is used in high level API and a component for inputting text.
In the text input component, operations are different when the number of displayed lines is one and when it is two or more.

When there is only one line displayed
Vertical scrolling is impossible when only one line is displayed.
When the character string cannot be displayed in one line, the excess part will be cut off and not shown.
When there are two or more lines
When there are two or more lines and the character string cannot be displayed in the lines on the display, a vertical scrolling screen shall be displayed.

Constructor Detail

TextBox

public TextBox(java.lang.String text,
               int columns,
               int rows,
               int mode)
The text box is created by designating the initial character string, the number of columns, the number of lines and the display mode. When created, it is visible and user-operable and the input mode is Alpha input mode. To set visible or invisible, the setVisible method is used. To set user-operable or user-inoperable, the setEnabled method is used. To switch input modes, the setInputMode method is used.

Parameters:
text - Designates the initial character string. When null is designated, an empty character string (" ") is set.
columns - Designates the number of columns. The number is counted as the number of the maximum width character under the current font size.
rows - Designates the number of rows.
mode - Designates the display mode for the character string. DISPLAY_ANY or DISPLAY_PASSWORD shall be designated.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Occurs when a value less than 0 is designated for arguments columns or rows or when an illegal value is designated for the argument mode.
Method Detail

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean b)
Sets the text box to be user-operable or user-inoperable. Regardless of whether or not the component is visible, the status can be changed by calling this method. In default, it is user-operable.

Specified by:
setEnabled in interface Interactable
Parameters:
b - Designates "true" to set user-operable and "false" to set user-inoperable.

requestFocus

public void requestFocus()
This requests the text box be put in focus. The requests issued before adding text boxes to the panel with the add method are ignored.

Specified by:
requestFocus in interface Interactable

setText

public void setText(java.lang.String text)
This sets the text character string. When it cannot be edited, this method can set character strings. When the mode is the password input mode and a character string is set using this method, only the set number of echo characters (* etc.) will be shown. When a character string is set, a component event (TEXT_CHANGED) is generated.

Parameters:
text - Designates the text character string. When null is designated, an empty character string (" ") is set.

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
This obtains the text character string.

Returns:
The text character string.

setInputMode

public void setInputMode(int mode)
This sets the initial input mode for text character strings. The initial input mode is the first mode to be set when the input method is activated. In default, it is the Alpha input mode.

Parameters:
mode - Designates the initial input mode. Either NUMBER, ALPHA or , KANA , TRADITIONAL_HANZI or SIMPLIFIED_HANZI can be designated.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Occurs when an illegal value is designated for the argument mode.

setEditable

public void setEditable(boolean b)
This sets whether the text character string can be edited or not. In default, it can be edited. Whether or not it is visible, it is possible to set it as editable or not editable by calling this method.

Parameters:
b - Designates "true" to set it as editable, and "false" for otherwise.
